Located at #03-05 of the mall.
Not that crowded even during holiday.
Wide range of options for the soup base, do take note that each person was expected to have an individual pot. The staff did mention that even if 2 people wished to share a pot, it was alright.
The food as fresh and the quantity was sufficient. The price was still considered reasonable.
The service was alright, but to compare with other hotpot restaurants, clearly it was lacking.

The joke was, one staff couldn’t even recognise me when I stood at the entrance after my meal. She still asked me if I wanted to go in to have a meal. And after I told her, that I just had a meal inside. She gave me the weird look.

A mini version of Beauty in a Pot, where each can order and individual hotpot. However, the good thing was is not like everyone has to order one hotpot, and two can actually share 1 too. No collagen broth but quite a few other flavours (more than Beauty), and ordered the ginseng chicken soup which was flavourful. The Tang O was very fresh and gave the soup an additional kick. Meat wise was also fresh. While I wouldn't say this is a budget friendly younger sibling of Beauty in a Pot, as the bill still came up to about $80+ for two. However, still worth to visit once in a while and especially if you are not planning in advance but kinda want it last minute.

Went on Thursday, 130 pm, they have 30% discount daily until 230pm. Then 40% discount from 231pm - 415 pm.

The soups were great, the meats, we ordered beef, pork, fish all tasted good with no funky smell or taste.
Veggies - spinach, mushrooms also were fresh.

You also get a free gelo? (not sure)  dessert
There is an extra price for condiments per person, 2.30sgd

Two person ard 90-100$ after discount. Coz portion of meat is quite small, so need to order more portions. In the end overall cost similar to other steamboat restaurants. Food is fresh. Cabbage is not good all the root side.  Generally I prefer beauty in the pot under the same group.

Visited at off peak hours to enjoy their 40% off food ingredients deal. Definetly worth it and their tomato soup base was definitely one of the best out there, and the food ingredients we ordered was good too as well.

A hidden gem on par with BIAP - this place is easily overlooked with a hole-in-the-wall entrance nestled between seemingly grander food options and we were really surprised by how it opens up to an unexpectedly spacious and cavernous dining area. The pork bone soup tasted EXACTLY like BIAP’s collagen soup and they even had the signature bean curd rolls?! With their 3-5pm 40% off it’s like getting BIAP for half the price. Everything we got was amazing as always for a restaurant under the paradise group; must order items include the bean curd roll, ebiko prawn paste and ramen.

Coming back for the 4th time on 28/3/22. Our staples for 3 ppl include:
- 1 portion of beef
- 1/2 portion of pork belly
- mushrooms: oyster, enoki, king oyster (not recommended to get shimeji as they swim around n get lost in the soup)
- pork and chive dumpling
- ebiko prawn paste
- 2 x ramen
- bean curd skin roll
- veggies: cabbage, tang-o
- condiments! My personal fav includes vinegar, soy sauce, chili oil, garlic, spring onions and parsley.
Really love this place for steamboat! Really recommend it ! Products are so fresh and clean! The pork broth is really good as well!

Definitely my favourite Hotpot Restaurant with individual pot of soup🥰. U can share a pot for 2 pax too. All the ingredients are really fresh and most importantly, have tried about 4types of their soup base so far and it's all been really yummy especially tomato🍅 base. #msgreedysis #greedybuddiez

We found the unit price of each food item increases quite a lot, almost 20 to 30% compared to last time we came about one year ago, though they still offered 40% during 2:30 to 4:30, for 2 pax, it costs almost 100 to get just 70% full.
The service is faster this time compared to one year ago, food itself is fresh and they do have Sacha souce that is quite rare to find in Singapore.
My first time here, service 👍 due to service charge also, some customers will give tips after paid bills. When busy peak period, slower waiting time.....me alone spend $30++
Tomato soup base is rich and flavourful. Sevice is great.

Served with individual pot cook under portable gas stove which may taste better but it always ran out of gas for like 3 times throughout the dining.
Services are not comparable to HaiDiLao but prices are almost the same - may be slightly more expensive if it’s not for the member voucher used.
Food are pretty good and soup is tasty which is a good change from your usual HaiDiLao menu.

May worth consider visiting during non-peak hours which has a promotion 40% going on between 2 - 4 pm on weekdays.

Spacious with soothing decor, clean and new, comfortable environment. Slightly different concept from their beauty in a pot branches as this gives you individual pots on a burner at your table. I guess it makes it slightly hard to see what’s in your pot and less options for soup base, but you get exclusivity! Also, they have kindly sorted into sets for the number of pax with all the popular ingredients (yay fried beancurd!) thus you don’t have to mull over what’s best to order. You can’t change any items in the set though.

The sets are really filling and gives you a bit of everything which is really nice. We took a 2 pax set $48.80++ and that excludes sauces ($2.20++ per pax). We added some beef and fried luncheon meats too. Water is not complimentary and chargeable at $0.30++ per glass refillable.

Their soup bases are similar (and more) as paradise beauty in a pot with the exclusion of collagen soup not available for sets. I stuck to my usual tomato (would have loved to have mushroom soup) but would try to be more adventurous next time.

Ingredients provided are fresh and the meatballs are really good and most tasted handmade.

Service is also polite and warm, with service staff constantly refilling your soup or water, and reminding you with little tips.

Do sign up for their membership to get rebates across their entire group of restaurants

I’ve visited Paradise Hotpot a couple of times — it has a similar concept to Beauty in A Pot / Haidilao except each person has their own little hotpot. It’s also has a similar price point as the two other restaurants stated above, but the difference is Paradise Hotpot offers a really great promo (40% off the total bill if you dine at off-peak hours), which makes it quite reasonable.

I don’t have any complaints about the ingredients. The seafood and vegetables are fresh, and I also enjoy the innards (eg kidney and liver). My favourite soup base is the pork soup, but I’ve also heard good reviews of the beef bone and chicken soup!

Service staff are attentive so that’s a plus. Overall, good atmosphere and good food, and a pleasant experience! I’ll definitely come again.

Food was fresh and good. They had 13 soup bases to choose from. Husband had the Teochew Style soup. I had the beef bone soup. We both preferred mine over his.

There is a teatime special promotion - 40% discount. Huge savings off the total bill. Together with the ShopBack Voucher I purchased ($40 for $50 worth) we ended up paying $82 for a bill of $132.

I would say this is the best hot pot in Singapore for me. I tried the famous Hxx , althought their service is impeccable,  the food n soup base lose out to paradise's hotpot.
The soup base here is superb n the ingredients are so fresh. What's more with the discounts of 30% from opening to 2.30pm, 40% from 2.30pm to 4pm, they are much cheaper than Hxx too.

Love and recommend their

1. Authentic Pork Bone Soup Base
2. Bean curd ring
3. Because of the thick n delicious soup,
all other ingredients n vegetables cooked in it would taste awesome esp with the wide variety of side condiments and sauce at $2.2 per pax chargeable.  I would mix coriander,  spring onions, garlic, cut fresh chilli,  pinch of salt, sesame oil n some premium light soya sauce for the ultimate kick.

Complimentary sweet dessert after meal too 🥰

We tried four soups, tomato, chicken teochew and kimchi. Tomato was rice and smooth, sweet n tangy, great for kids and adults. Teochew was obviously good. Chicken broth was nice and light. Kimchi soup was not too spicy. Beef were all good, ad well as signature dishes. Everything was fresh.

Service was good, staff very responsive and quick to clear empty plates. Prices quite high though, three adults and two kids the bill came to $250

There's something about trying a new place when they've just opened. We had a horrible experience at Paradise Hotpot years ago when they just started.. and we've avoided it ever since. But I came back today to give it another shot and I think they are a lot more competent now - but not spectacular. And given that the bill would have been ~$100 without the 40% discount during super off peak.. its a tad pricey.. don't you reckon? (and I ate alone ;)
One of the best hotpot places in the northeast part of sg :-) you can share the soups too. The service varies depending on the server but 80% it's good!

We ordered the Teochew and Tom yum broths and they were delicious. 4 pax shared 2 broths and it was actually quite okay, cos the pots though advertised as individual pots, were a good size. They allowed us to add soup later on. All the ingredients we ordered were very fresh. The fish ball with fish roe was especially delicious. What a good satisfying meal.
The food is fresh, environment and service are great... Especially the taste of the soup 👍
All the staff in The restaurant are very friendly and helpful. The food are good and they have very good promotion during 2.pm to 4.30pm Daily. 40%off on all food.

👍 for Friends and Family.
Love the ideas of personal pot as you get to try different flavours when you eat with friends or family.

💕Service’s quite fast, and the staff are attentive and friendly. Even though the portable gas seems to run out very often, the staff are quick to fix it.

🥩 Ingredients are fresh and very well presented with wide selections!
If your table ran out of space for the food, they will provide food trolley / cart for your food. My Favourite will be the Teochew Style Fish Paste & Beancurd Skin.

🌟Comfortable and relaxing environment.
Will definitely return again.

Price a bit too high! Service good!

Excellent service from Chunyan at Paradise Hotpot! She really went out of her way to rectify a mistake by the foodpanda rider.

When we called the restaurant, the staff was already waiting for my call, and explained that the rider had picked up the ingredients and left without collecting the soup base. She then got my address and cabbed down to my place herself to deliver the missing soup base. Very grateful for the excellent service and great attitude.

If there were 6 stars we would give 7 😄
Individual hotpot, selection not as much as "beauty in the pot 美滋锅", price about the same.

Expensive and feel not really nice. 2 of us eat dinner already $59.70
Nothing special.

Until she saw me at my table, she then realised she was helping me halfway.

When we called the restaurant, the staff was already waiting for my call, and explained that the rider had picked up the ingredients and left without collecting the soup base. She then got my address and cabbed down to my place herself to deliver the missing soup base. Very grateful for the excellent service and great attitude.

If there were 6 stars we would give 7 😄
Individual hotpot, selection not as much as "beauty in the pot 美滋锅", price about the same.

Expensive and feel not really nice. 2 of us eat dinner already $59.70
Nothing special.

Food quality is ok but poor service. Was there at 5.30pm, approximately 10 tables of guests. My 2nd order of food took more than 30 mins to be served. And it was after a reminder from me to check on my order. One of the waitress who was attending to me halfway scooted off to the cashier to bill customers. When she was done, she forgot she was attending to me halfway. She then went to push a cart containing soups and beverages around. Until she saw me at my table, she then realised she was helping me halfway.
Good service, awesome food! The ingredients are fresh and the soup bases are delicious. My family's favourite...the teochew style soup...a must try. Lunch time promotion - 30% off. Good deal.
My favourite hotpot place. The lunchtime discount is awesome. Can’t wait to go back again.
Good food as usual! 3 pax around $100

Totally immerse with the Tom yam soup! Especially when days that you are feeling down, hotpot at paradise will never go wrong!

The best time to pop by are during lunch and tea time, to make your money worth while! since they are having promotions! But not to fear, always call to make reservation for weekend dinners (Friday, Saturday, Sunday)

Did a company event here years back and the service is really 👍🏻👍🏻👍🏻👍🏻. As a fan of hotpot, I will recommend here as compare to those Buffet style. Good food, good service, worth coming!

Service was bad. Food was worse. Had pork broth and tomato corn soup base and they were not good. I thought the Paradise brand prides itself for being a top player in the market. Well, this truly was disappointing. Water had sand grains at the bottom of the glass, and when asked about it, the wait staff couldn't explain and hey, no apology was given. I couldn't even make out what they served for dessert. Not coming back to this outlet for sure.
Good atmosphere, good quality of food. You pay for what you get. 👍
Same group as the beauty in the pot.... ingredients similar with similar pricing... but have discount ranging from 30 to 40%. Service level not as good as beauty in the pot. Very different soup base.

Another table left early, when I pay for both table the cashier argued say the other table got 3 sauces and can even name the sauces. Already told them no sauce, once I cally mum ask them, it is no sauce, they suddenly say yaya no sauce... Trying to cheat money!!!

We love the food here. Highly quality and full of flavour! We especially love the salad prawns, century egg appetiser, and black pepper beef.

We did have to remind them to serve the glass of water when almost all the dishes arrived though.

Everything else was pleasant and chill.

Quality of food still remains and my favourites still stay at the standard expected of the restaurant's reputation. Unfortunately service was a little tardy as the restaurant is busy and have to request for waitering staff multiple times to get condiments.
Nice roast duck noodles with crispy skin.. Favorite accompanied with sour and spicy thick soup. Usually quite packed during lunch, so good to visit earlier.

The restaurant's roast meats are quite palatable.A light texture with a slight crunch.

delectable. mouth watering.

scrumptious meal

Canton Paradise CompassOne has had a major redecoration and it looks great.
As usual, the food was great and the service staff was attentive and helpful.
Always a good place for a tasty meal.
The roast duck is awesome. Their main dishes are pretty good too. The dim sum though, is just average for a higher tier restaurant such as this. I don’t mind returning for their roast meat.

First dine in after phrase 2 was over and glad that the experience was largely positive. Food was decent, especially like the HK style congee though the pig intestine was a tad too rubbery and hard to chew. Service was prompt and friendly which is always a plus. Will go back again.

The place was full. We made a reservation for 1pm and was seated in around 1.10pm due to full seating.

Food was served up considerably fast after ordering. Taste wise the food was good and the price is justified. For the premium price, the taste was premium too.

We had the noodles and congee as mains and they were just fantastic. The congee was well cooked and the taste blended in perfectly. The noodles were springy and the meat (Irish fat duck) was so juicy. Combined with their delicious greens and signature sauce, it is something you won't taste in hawker establishments.

Dim sum wise we had the harkau and liu Sha bao. Both were well presented but only averagely tasting. Har kau skin was too thick, and lacking in taste, despite the full filling of prawns. Liu Sha bao was cute but also lacking in flow ability and also buns were not fluffy enough.

Overall, it was a very good lunch and we would definitely come back again due to the friendly service.

One thing that can be improved is the speed of serving drinks so that we can remove our masks.

My fav dim sum joint !
Love their egg tarts , siew Mai , har kao, chicken claws and more !!

Update for the month of December 2021
Nice renovated interior !
Bright and cozy.
Added some new photo.

Updated July 2021
Added New photo  :)
No changes ....Still 5 stars  :)

Update Review for the Month of May 2021 ( Just before No dining in :-) )
Added Some New Photo  ;-)
First of all, thanks to the chinese lady by the name of Yique for your excellent customer service. The Food came fast. ALL are very delicious and that includes the beverage that i have ordered ( Water Chest Nut + Ice Lemon Tea ) The Sweet And Sour Pork is NOT hard ....Surprisingly it was Tender and Juicy.... Oh and the French bean it was very very delicious....Loved it when mixed with the Minced Pork.... By the way i have lost count of how many times i have dine/pack away order @ this outlet  :-)

2020 Review This Canton Paradise @ Sengkang their Porridge is super delicious and their Roast Duck is SUPER Good.
Not worth the long wait and ended with food that is not living up to expectation. First and last time. Ding Tai Feng or Soup Restaurant is a better alternative.

One of the paradise group restaurants that never fails to deliver good food and services.

It’s usually crowded during dinner time especially weekends so do expect estimate of 30 minutes waiting time.

Food came relatively quick after ordering.
Beef noodle - it’s surprisingly good on both the noodle and meat! Would even be better if the portion is slightly bigger.
Ting Zai congee - one of the signature dish and its tasty even without soy sauce.
XO carrot cake - soft and fragrant
Liu Sa Bao - nicely presented though it seems to downsize a little
Spicy vinegar dumplings - well filled on the ingredients

If you were to go during weekday 3 - 5pm, there is an ongoing tea time promotion with up to 40% discount. If not otherwise it may be slightly pricey.

Never going to order from here again and i advise others not to as well unless you rly nothing better to do. Waited close to 1hr for delivery food and yet still preparing. Not the first time as well. Had to head down personally to see whats the situation and found out so many riders waiting for orders. Poor kitchen management. DTF or paradise dynasty better than this

1. most of the staff were good, but one of them, Yi Qiu was mean and ignorant. we tried so hard to order the food and had requests like taking photo, but she ignored us when we asked 3 times.
2. one of the dish, the roast duck, was not roasted well enough. it was frozen meat and the texture was too hard. i wouldnt order it if i were you.
3. what kind of establishment is this? no tablecloth and the table is dirty. i pay for expensive service charge and the food is expensive, but i do not receive equal amount of service that i paid for. i mean seriously? if i walk into a high paying restaurant, paying 8 dollars for service, at least set up a new tablecloth to give me good hygiene!!
Consistent dim sum & Cantonese cuisine in the heartlands but portions have reduced over time, becoming more costly by the day!

The food was well done, with an authentic Cantonese flair. Some dishes to look out for would be their roast meat platter and spiced dumplings.

Service was adequate, but the place is usually swamped in the evenings, with long wait times and poorer service. At times it felt like the place was understaffed. The service staff made do with the manpower they had however, and did their best to make the dining experience enjoyable.

Would definitely recommend having a meal here if authentic Cantonese cuisine is what you are looking for.

It's a nice place to dine in with the family. There's a great variety of chinese/cantonese-style food to please everyone in my family, from my parents-in-law to my young children. And I love that they now cater to vegetarians too by including a number of great vegetarian dishes in their menu.

Dined a couple of times, on weekdays evenings and weekends mealtimes it can be quite crowded but weekends 3-5pm it’s rather empty.

Food 🍽
Recommended dishes are:
- roast pork belly/ bbq pork
- XO carrot cake
- signature bbq pork bun with boluo crust
- congee - so smooth and delicious
- HK milk tea - served in an iced tumbler, very creamy and full of flavour
- Cheong fun (rice rolls)
- glutinous chicken rice wrapped in pandan leaf - it’s a small portion so just nice for one to eat

Ambience and accessibility 🕯♿️
Have seen plenty of elderly in wheelchair coming in and restaurant is spacious thus definitely accessible. They will even help to shift the chairs to make way for wheelchair to slot into the table instead. Have baby chairs and also booth seats.

Service is generally pretty attentive and welcoming. Do note the nuts at the start are chargeable so feel free to reject if you like. Wet tissues are also chargeable.

If you have a Citibank card, pay with it and get $10 return voucher with $50 min spend. Weekdays 3-5pm diners can also enjoy 40% off dim sum

One of the better Tim Sum place in SengKang
Tim Sum quality is consistently good.
Avoid lunch and dinner times during weekends due to overcrowding.
Drink portions are small
Service has room for improvement

20171119 - seems a little overwhelming on dining times, better to plan time accordingly. When compared to taste paradise (ion orchard), the food served here is less impressive. rice skin has a tangy taste to it, not fully firm. pig organs in the porridge should be sliced thinner, else they are not cooked evenly. XO stir fry rice cake were wet and bland - could not finish. on a broad basis, it is above average but as a paradise group and price (raised) component, it does not meet the mark. service is good and attentive. 4-star at best.

After confirming additional food order, the food did not come despite 3 attempts to remind the service personnel. When it comes to payment, it was promptly included though.

Updated review. Service has improved although they still miss out on 1 item on our order.
Great food as usual. From the century egg to wanton mee to crispy char siew bun and the fantabulous egg tarts, we couldn't get enough of it. Just a tad costly though

Good food & good service.
Salted egg prawn: 5/5. SGD21.5 without GST. Only 6pcs. However, the prawn are big and fresh!
Sweet and sour pork: 5/5. Best sweet and sour pork in Singapore.
Tofu salt pepper: 2/5. So so...

Nice Cantonese cuisine and also dim sum dishes available. Good soups plus 3 types meat available - steam chicken, roast pork, Barbeque pork! Noodles were also tasty n done el dente. Can be quite crowded during peak n may have to wait for a table. Many weekly offers available n also member discounts.

The food and service was really good! Highly recommend to give this restaurant a try! It is part of the part of the paradise group chain of restaurants in Singapore. Cost wise it is also very affordable and won’t break the bank! Would visit again!

I think this place deserves more credit. Everything that I ordered today was perfect. Service was a little sub-standard, but the food... I would come here just for the food. The 水餃 was crunchy, light, the XO Carrot Cake flavorful, and the E-fu noodles just the right amount of oil.
Roast duck, egg tart & crispy bbq pork bun are recommended. However, the molten salted egg yolk piggy bun was a big disappointment. It’s more like a paste than “molten”. Cute but not worth it.

WoW. Is it possible that every dish you order is worth your 4 or 5 star rating without complains?

That is what happened to my family and I last week. Food ordered were roast duck (yummy), braised beef (with tendon in clay-pot), spinach (wet with egg), chee chung fun (crispy mushroom), pear and ribs soup (double boiled), 3 treasures porridge(smooth).

Staff were attentive and courteous even though placed was PACKED. The queue outside was insane. Quality food and family time spent =)

Took the signature porridge, fried bean curd wrap and the egg tarts. Egg tarts were the only dish worth commending. The rest were too salty and not half as good as those at the Canton Paradise at JEM, Jurong.

Nice food and attentive staff.
Well organized after renovation.

The branch at Compass One, food is average or below...I have visited 5 times before their renovation...food was tasty, non-oily and fresh back than...but today's visit was so terrible...noodles were too stiff too oily...sweet sour pork was too oily and the pineapple has already turn bad...it such a bad experience...I would not recommend anyone to visit...the standard of food handling, cooking and taste are kind of hopeless...
Delicious food and well presented. Staff were helpful and the dishes came out quite quick one after another.
A great place to get some dim sum and Cantonese food. Love the Jumbo prawn wanton noodle as well. Can be quite crowded and noisy.
BBQ platter & XO carrot cake standard seems to drop. Overall satisfactory.

Finished all our food, totally wiped clean. Great quality food, pleasant and warm service staff, consistently good, family friendly, a bit pricey to the wallet, but it’s really decent quality Cantonese dim-sum. Generous Portion and nice for a family dinner together.

Ordered their Yang-Zhou fried rice - 5/5, can be shared with 3 person,
we had steamed rice roll with fried bean curd - 4/5, extremely tasty and need to be shared or it becomes ‘jelat’.
Steamed pork-bun, nice char siew filling....
Prawn steamed dumpling aka Xiao long bao - decent, but can make their skin thinner...
Steamed pork meat dumpling in chili oil... nice! It’s not too spicy and ‘numb-ing’!

All in all, I love the experience and I will certainly come back for more!
Price is reasonable and the food is also not bad. There is also promotion for duck meats per plate at only $8.80. (U.P $18).

Very dishonest practice and misrepresentation. The waitress gave us two plates of fish skin and said please try as appetizer, if you like it,you can buy two packets at 13.80. we asked if it's chargeable and she repeated the same to ask us to try.

One of my folks started eating the first plate and another waitress came and said it's chargeable.. we were shock and she said it's okay, she will bring one back and only charge one plate. It's covid season, they left food down when our masks were down and they took it back to serve another table ..

At the cashier I asked if they knew they were dishonest and many had complained, the cashier just smiled and kept quiet. She did not refund when I requested and just said," I will feedback".

Simply dishonest Canton Paradise staffs..
Patrons, please beware.
food n service are pretty decent just like any of their similar outlets. due to it is in a heartland mall best to make advance booking.

Brought my son for dimsum promo at 3.30pm... But disappointed that Xiao Long Bao and egg tarts are not available... These are what my son wants to eat... So ended up we didn't eat anything from dimsum menu...

Egg tart was too sweet
Hor fun was too oily

The rest are not bad
The food good staff good but the whole restaurant got mirrors everywhere, no matter where you turn can see people
Food quality and service standard has dropped. Price has gone up. Tea charged by no. of persons, although the serving size is the same - one pot regardless of head count (add water only).
Wonderful service, nice dim sum and definitely great service!

I called the hotline to try to get a booking but my call was turned down every time. Called multiple times over different timings throughout the day but same thing all the time. "Open for bookings" they say.

Dine in the restaurant a little later after typical lunch time to avoid the crowd.

The admission was quick and friendly, the waitress came promptly to take our order and the meal was served up pretty quickly.

The food quality is good and the portion is appropriate for the price. However, the lack of the 5th star was attributed by the lack of attention from the staff, we have to wave our hands fanatically and called out loudly before I can get my chili sauce.

But the dining experience was saved by a senior (age, not ranking) staff who took over the service from the other one who was supposed to be waiting at our table. She was friendly and chatty but not overwhelming for us to enjoy our meal.
Food is yummy. Very good service. Even take temp and Sanitize all customers hands before going in.
Now they had a promotion if order value above $30, free kids menu set
Currently there promotion ongoing for member. Expect to be crown during weekend dinner
I order pick up from food panda, and the item late for 35-40 mins from the agreed time. Poor management!
Happy hours discount is fabulous. Comfort food to the max

Nice little 煮炒, air-conditioned, neat and clean. We had deep fried squid, tofu and broccoli. The prices may be steeped compared to coffee-shop prices but I think it is worthwhile as it is after all air-conditioned. I like it that the food isn't salty or taste like msg. The tofu was soft on the inside and crispy on the outside. As I don't eat pork, I simply scrapped the pork toppings from the tofu. I appreciate that the waitress is service-oriented. She was attentive and the food were served very promptly. Oh yes, their barley was homemade without the canned drink type of taste. We'll definitely be back!

Worth visiting if you are looking for Chinese food in Jalan Kayu area. Visited on Friday evening. Quite packed around 7pm and seems to be short of experienced server. We were seated inside and situation was sort of chaotic as the service staffs seems very disoriented but they are doing their best to serve.

Food came out of kitchen at a fast speed. Taste wise is good. Of all the dishes ordered (sorry not all had pictures), we only find curry fish head gravy a bit watery and Mongolia pork ribs not to our expectation. The rest of dishes were good. Especially the homemade tofu and hand shredded cabbage are very nice.

They had local food and also SiChuan dishes. Saw a lot of others ordering grill fish. Will want to try in next visit! And hoped that their service staffs are better trained up by then.

Was looking for a TingKat meal for the family during the CV19 period and was recommended this place. Was informed that they had to convert to TongKat business due to the CV19 and I’m glad that they did. Coz it allowed my family and I to have a taste of their home cook style food. Also... might I add that there’s a standard to their cooking. Unlike mass cooked food caterers, you can see the effort and pride put into preparing the food.

Received the first delivery today and am really impressed. Rice was well cooked. Not too hard nor soft. Braised fish was fresh and not too spicy or salty. Mushrooms are not the el cheapo type of mushrooms. Soup was yummy and flavorful too.

Over all... they are not the cheapest in the market but comparing the food quality and that the food is delivered hot... it’s definitely worth every cent. Portions are generous too. My family are quite heavy eaters and are all quite stuffed after lunch.

Was so impressed that am going to change the 10 days trial to prob the 20 days menu.

Mala hotpot with beef. Soup mild spiciness, beef added flavour to the soup. Homemade tofu thumb up, with a little minced pork and spring onion soya sauce blends well. La Zi Ji, bits of chicken skin, was crispy. Also their Mongolian salted egg pork another must try(not in pic)
The fish head curry is good. But the price point is higher than normal Zi char. Very surprised that the food taste very good

We ordered delivery since heightened alert in May. Made several rounds of changes to reservations due to restrictions. Lady was super patient in handling changes including menu change. I was quite paiseh. She eventually delivered it to me personally to Punggol in Sept. On time. Food was good. The $99 crab promo for 2 was worth it. Surprisingly not small for the price. Lala n tofu were good too. Hopefully to visit the actual store soon.

Tasty Mongolian pork rib ($15.90) & FuRong egg ($11.90) for dinner.

Portion was reasonable but unfortunately prices went up quite a lot by between 22% to 49%.

Only one waitress managing and occasionally a kitchen staff help to serve out food , so be prepared to wait.

I must admit that this waitress is superb at handling the dinner crowd; taking orders, collect payment, serving food, clearing & cleaning tables - where to find

Food and ambiance was great!
Crayfish was fresh
Tried the mala fish and taste good. Kids like the tofu too.

Food: 4* but slightly sweet for mee goreng,  others just nice.
Service: 4*
Chrysanthemums and rose tea: 4*
Location: shop just in front of the bus stop at Jalan Kayu.
Will be back again to try other foods

The price of food is quite reasonable. The taste was OK for some of the food. The shop also offers quite a number of "China" style food (which we happen to not order).

The services is also good as they will help to top up hot water for drinks as well as help to pour the tea.

Definitely will comeback

Love their food. Their hotpot is good and their chi zhar is good. They're one of our favourite stalls at Jalan Kayu, but unfortunately the restaurant is severely understaffed. There's only one poor guy as waiter during peak hours, and you can see him struggling to juggle so many tables.

If you're the owner of the place who happe  to read this, please for the love of good food hire more help for your restaurant.

My 2nd visit n this time I brought my family along. Enjoyed all the dishes while seated in the airconditioned area. The service from the staff is once again  great n staff is courteous n patience. Highly recommended.

We ordered FuRong Omelette, MaPo ToFu, baby kailan, hot & spicy boneless chicken. The food was delectable! The service was outstanding. Short-staffed but still attentive. They checked if we preferred chopsticks or fork/spoon. They made sure we knew size portion, etc. They communicated well. Everything arrived quickly. Beer was served ice-cold as well. Premises was spotless and tables very clean. No GST and no service charge, so definitely deserve a tip!

Very good food... Specially the seafood and curry fish head.
Recommend to call and book in advanced.
Am super impressed with their service during the 2 pax limit time.
We had 2 + 1 pax that time. Lady host offered to assist to split portions equally into 2. She frequently check on us if need additional assistance.
Keep up the great service and food.

Good tze char food in the Jalan Kayu area, the milk tea is great and I recommend ordering it. Service is fast and prompt. My partner and I love the Szechuan-inspired food, particularly the kao yu. Tried the salted veg one and the signature one before and it was very delicious.

The only bad thing is that there are no options to put extra ingredients into the broth.
Delicious comforting grilled fish. The non-spicy option was delightfully tasty. Need to wait abit as the restaurant can be packed at peak periods.

Update: standard has dropped, waiting is now endless, and it’s really hard to get food decently here.

-old outdated-
Umpteenth visit to this aircon clean zhichar place with great food and reasonable prices. Ate the seafood horfun again and again.. with lovely wokhei for only $6.50. highly recommended

Finally got to try this place along jalan kayu, which happened to be open despite being CNY D3! We walked past a couple of times and it’s always filled with long queues. Food is pretty tasty, decent pricing although the portions tend to be slightly on the small side! Must haves: salted egg chicken, ngoh hiang, furong egg (has lots of ingredients inside and very soft!)! Toilet is super clean, like that at orchard road!

Visited this restaurant a couple times. The restaurant is located alongside several eateries on Jalan Kayu. On both visits, the restaurant was not very crowded and we got a table immediately.
Service is good from arriving at restaurant, ordering food and waiting time.
On this visit, I ordered the curry fishhead. The taste is perfectly balanced and really delicious.
The shop is also kept very clean and bright.
Overall experience is very good.

Satisfied with their service here. Food was ok but will be better if dishes like yangzhou fried rice and furong egg can be less oily and lacking of wok hey smell. Will revisit again for their Sichuan dishes and western food, hope it will not disappoint us.
food is nice. staff is friendly. outside seats too many mosquitoes.

Great flavour food. Have the sichuan style. Price is affordable. Can be short handed during peak hours during to only 2 staff on floor. Parking lots available at open carpark around 8mins away. Hidden gem.

Tasty and decent pricing.
Sweet and sour pork rice was too sweet, but the Mee goreng was good!
Accepts cash, nets and Amex.

We happened to step in to this place by luck due to our prior bad experience with another Bistro. We were super surprised with the food choices, quality and taste of the food. The gold plating was the service offered by Wei Meng, we loved it.. Thanks for making our Sunday evening blissful.. Highly Recommend this Heroic place..
Taste good. 3 dashes (photos) + 2 drinks and 2 rice at about $40. Will try again!
Japanese oysters not on the menu, quite fresh and tasty! Fried rice portion a bit small but taste wise is good 👍
Reasonably priced food. However, fried dim sum is at best average.
Portion was alright, good place for family dinner, lunch hours is not packed, but for dinner do call ahead to make booking

This is apparently their clay pot noodles. First time I’ve seen a clay pot noodles with soup. I overheard the service staff asking the kitchen staff why was there soup, but somehow it still was served to me. The service staff also insisted that the clay pot noodles had soup in it. Benefit of the doubt I suppose. The “claypot noodles” was passable. An egg was also forgotten from my order.

In the half an hour in this establishment, there was also a blackout.
The male waiter is pretty rude and the service is extremely slow. Food is so so and be ready to wait and be seen as transparent.

We had the hot pot today and it was nice!  Husband got the chilli dip and I had the sesame dip.  Mix them both and it was really yummy!  Will be great if we can have different drink choices instead of the default lime juice :)
Hotpot is great!! Must order beef.... absolutely 💯% recommended ❤️

Very unpleasant dining experience at Lao Hero kitchen on 12 Mar around 6:30pm. , I booked a 6-8 seated round table at the back of the restaurant 2 days prior, with another 5-6 seated square table at the corner as backup in case of the former was occupied on that day. The manager of the restaurant told me she might not be able to secure the round table for me if a group with 6 or more people came before me on that day. But she promised that the 6 seated table at the back corner of the restaurant would definitely be reserved for me. I agreed and a confirmation message was sent to my phone afterwards. However, on the actual day, the round table was taken while the 6 seated table at the corner was deliberately split into tables for 2 and 4. Confused, I approached the staff and she told us to sit at the table near the door. After explaining to her about the reservation 2 days prior, she helped merge the tables together and let us sit there. However, the manager saw this later on and approached the staff, reprimanded her for letting us occupy that table, and demanded us to shift, we told her that we had booked that table and she said she was aware but still demanded us shift to the table near the entry door. My friend was shocked what was happening and demand a explanation and apology. Although we were finally allowed to occupied the table we booked, but no apologies were given at all and the manager was extremely impatient the whole time. I was really appalled and disappointed by their rude service and will definitely won’t recommend this restaurant.

Ordered cereal prawn, broccoli scallop & 2 chili crabs with a seafood soup. Didn't manage to criticize any of the dishes. All dishes of the taste found spot on and waitress was single handling the ground in well manner. Lastly, the rice was quality. Expandable future.

food is good but only 3 stars because there is a young waitress who served my table that was very unprofessional and rude. She served and push a hot bowl to my table that 烫到 my hand but she just walked away 😓 when serving it, she didn’t even say excuse me to inform us she was placing the hot bowl down.   (also she also wears a really short denim shorts while working????)

Great food & service. They have promotion for crabs currently. Crabs are fresh and in decent size. Value for money👍😋. And whole rows of interesting food shops outside the restaurant including durian cake was good.  Will go again.

Been there afew times, both dine in & takeout.  The crab promo is a good deal. Their crabs are fresh & of good quality, especially loving their black pepper crab. Their hor fun is good too. Their price is reasonable and no service charge if you dine in. Free milk tea if you order for takeaway.

I made a reservation via Chope, was happy there was a follow up automated call to confirm the booking & I had specifically state i need the coolest seat available yet when we turn up they told us 'reservation' seat are all alfresco seats & we have to wait till the diners indoor are done. What was not acceptable was no table was set up ready for us at their alfresco area despite telling us 'reservation' is outdoor. If you cannot afford to take reservation, DON'T. I don't see any customer service provided. Totally disappointed & left since the they prefer to entertain walk ins.
Cosy place . Good food . Will come back again . Nice experience

Nice food yet not too expensive and quite affordable depending on people's views. Restaurant has nice interior and seemingly unique exterior. Service is good with friendly waitress who seems to like to talk to customers.
Nice Chinese food.
Visited multiple times since they opened. Friendly staff always.

Nice and cosy place to dine with good air conditioning. Staff was polite and responsible but do note that, I was dining during off peak hours. The restaurant operates on staggered hours so please call to confirm and reservation maybe required for evening peak hour dining. Food pricing is definitely economical and affordable dining in such environment.

My family & I liked this place food and overall Lao Hero kitchen food are good not too salty but tasty n environment is also nice . Now they have promotion for 2 crabs $60 & can cook 2 types of sauces & foc 6 buns. Worth to eat😋😋😋😋.

Terrible experience and customer service!
3 of us went and restaurant was kinda full, there was an empty small round-shaped table available but the waitress did not invite us in, we assumed it was being reserved. Waited at the door for around 15-20 minutes, another group of 6 queued behind us and obviously did not made a reservation, but was being invited in directly. When we asked the waitress, she replied because they can use the round-shaped table, and wanted us to wait for another smaller square-shaped table, with the customers still eating half way and who looked like gonna take at least 15-20 minutes to finish eating. We turned around and left, totally disappointed with this kind of service, and the waitress looked like she couldn't be bothered more.
Great job in prioritizing profit maximization rather than customer's experience! Will not recommend anyone to patron this restaurant!

Terrible service.
First, long waiting time for our group of 6 despite the restaurant being only half full.
Secondly, the PRC waitress had to ask us what we ordered when serving out our food when it eventually came. After that, she even got another table's order for ice water wrong and delivered it to our table!

Only saving grace is its food which is decent.

Ordered food for pick up. Came at the timing they told us to come and they didn’t have it yet. Waited for another 15 minutes but the food wasn’t ready. Had to ask them again before they realise they already packed the food but didn’t search it properly the first time. The food also became cold since it was left waiting for so long. No apologies offered as well. Really bad customer service.

A very neat & clean chic air con Chinese restaurant. To be fair, for $6/- a small black hot clay pot of Lao Hero Laksa is graded satisfactory. The sliced fish cakes were not fresh and only 2 medium size prawns. Much improvement needed on the laksa.

Cosy place with good food and great service. A wide variety of dishes are available and on weekdays, there are lunch sets. The food portion is generous and balance of taste is just right. Prawn paste chicken is a must try. Will definitely return to try more on the menu.

Was recommended to come here and the place didn't disappoint! Really surprised at the food quality and taste despite being located in an obscure location of a residential neighbourhood. The residents in the area really lucked out!

Food and good and tasty, also generally not too spicy. Service was good but the food took a little longer than expected to come out. From the looks of things, the kitchen is pretty small so can't be helped. Totally forgot to take a pic of their winner dish cause it was so good. Some special pork which you stuff into a fried mantou. Sorry this doesn't help much.

Definitely will be back to eat again.

What a cute find in Buangkok! The menu looks super tasty and the dishes served up didn’t disappoint. Highlights were the grilled spicy sliced fish, mapo tofu, fried eggplant and that sweet and sour pork (in a nostalgic batter from our childhood) made for a very moreish dinner. Prices are great, peppercorns are numbing and we will be back soon to eat the rest of the menu.

Environment was clean.
Some hits and misses here for the dishes.

Fried rice with slightly bland. There was some canned luncheon meat, carrots, egg and sliced pork.

The beef hot pot stock was quite salty. The beef was sliced beef. Our guess is they are using frozen beef. When it came, a chunk of them were stuck together and raw when we separated them.
We ate a total of 1 slice. There was also canned luncheon meat.

Cabbage was crunchy and tasty with slight umami. Quite good.

The fried bun with pork was very nice. Slight porky taste. But still bearable if you are not sensitive to it.

So overall I would have to say this isn’t value for money if you are going for quality of ingredients.
Would be a nice restaurant to pop in if you stay around the area. I’m quite sure they have other dishes that are tasty. However, this was all I could eat.
Really liked this place!! Good vibes and good food, had no complaints on the customer service too! Maybe jus a tad lil pricey but i would say for the taste, i would definitely come back for more.

Extremely tasty Sichuan dishes 🙌 Service was A+ too, the kitchen missed our order out, and compensated by giving us a free dish! Food is very affordable for the quality, WILL DEFINITELY COME BACK AGAIN :) 好吃!

Very comfortable environment.  unique and special.  Like a garden different with other Chinese restaurant.
Food are authentic.  Tasty. Potion enough for us.  Worth to try
Highly recommended, and probably one of the better Sichuan cuisines in Singapore. Very authentic and the 水煮牛肉 is really tasty. I will definitely go again. Worth the extra mile! 👍
Love their zichar dishes, especially the 烤鱼片片香 & 金汤肥牛. Great food at reasonable price. Portions are of good size. Will definitely return again!
Food was alright but the place is dirty. We were seated behind near the kitchen and floor is wet. The water is coming out from the kitchen. Staffs are not attentive to customers.
Surprisingly good. Loved the eggplant and salted mushroom.

The food is a little bit pricy but acceptable. Don't recommend order 老北京羊蝎子 as the portion is quite small.
As for the taste, it is good.
The most upset thing happened was the table next to us was realy loud. other customers also asked them to keep voice low but no use. So it was horrible experience in terms of the environment. However I'm sure this is an occasional case.
Be there twice. Food is just ok. Not aware can use their promotion tab via online menu. Order same dish but like 10 dollar more cash. Unable to refund back.
Food so so. Price is reasonable.
Very nice ambience. Good food and reasonable price. Will come back again.
Very nice food, price reasonable and cosy atmosphere. Highly recommend
price a bit pricey but the taste is good...

Good vibe restaurant. Clean & comfy, food was served fast on a not so busy weekday afternoon
Mapo Tofu = Good taste, authentic not too oily compare with others
Grilled sliceFish = Fresh fish, fresh ingredient
Rice = Fragrant rice, not the usual dry/cheap type

Just returned from the family's first visit to he cafr after we shifted to this area, so we decided to give it a go! Environment was really pleasant, the interior feels like that of a vegetarian dining cafe. The customer's srervice was really commentary- you get alert and friendly staffs. Food is relatively good and we were quite surprised by the portions , certainly sufficient for larger groups. The fried rice on the other hand needs to be improved though 🤪 overall, nice vibes!

Been here twice. So far all dishes we've tried seem to be quite spot on. Kudos, keep it up.
authentic sichuan food and one spicy level is enough for me! Avoid the crowd when ordering. Lady boss is pretty :)

Great food at great pricing! Recommend the 水煮牛肉!
I would drive all the way from Jurong to go eat there again!
Food was authentic ! Plating exceeded expectations, price was very reasonable . Great place to unwind after work .
Reasonable price for a Sichuan dinner. Enjoyed very much for the quality of cooking is even better than those at town. Must try !

Boon Tong Kee is your chicken rice stall at your local coffee shop, but ✨ fancy ✨. Food is good though, paid about $16 for a chicken rice set meal with peanuts, broccoli and also a drink to go along with it and gotta say, yummy. Only thing is that $16 is somewhat too much for chicken rice considering there’s coffee shops selling stuff similar to this for $5, but the air conditioning, clean tables and friendly staff makes up for it slightly. Overall, quite good for a chicken rice enthusiast like me.

Basically good ol’ chicken rice with upscale zichar vibes!

Some dishes such as their classic steamed chicken and 炒粒粒were delicious, whereas some really bordered on being too salty (the braised tofu with seafood had wayyyyy too much sodium than needed)

Prices are also much higher than your regular kopitiam chicken rice, but that’s reasonable for the location and the fact that it’s a standalone restaurant.

All dishes are yummy tonight!

Food tastes are much better than delivery. This branch location is convenient. Just a straight walk after exit MRT station.

Place is clean & service  consistence. Food portion just right & testy of course. But they use dettol as cleaning solution for table, leaving a strong disinfecting smell quite unpleasant. They can use odourless disinfecting solution. Just a suggestion.
Food is always served quickly and its delicious. Rice is tasty, chicken is tender, and chilli is not too spicy but still adds alot of flavour.

Had dinner here. Chicken and vegetables were ok, but sweet and sour pork was terrible! No pieces of meat at all, just pork fats and flour crumbs, see photo! Tiny pieces, not a single proper piece of meat. We gave feedback, was told their boss said that "their sweet and sour pork is like that one, is all fats one, no meat, that's the way they cook."

Ridiculous! Shame on them. Never order their sweet and sour pork, such a disappointment.

It's a chicken rice place, so we ordered chicken rice. The steamed chicken was great and the sauce was really good. The prawn roll and crispy tofu were tasty too. Service was very good, prompt and friendly. This place is walk-in only and didn't take reservations.
This Boon Tong Kee outlet is probably the nicest one I’ve been too so far! Very upmarket feel with very reasonable pricing. The service was also great!

General service is good. 5 stars because of this lady who really made our dining experience  positive. She will check on us to see if chilli is enough, or needed to pack when she saw some leftover. She also make sure that our additional takeaway order is only  when we almost done with our dine in. So that we won't have to wait too long and still warm.

However the food quality has dropped. The chicken meat is hard, still tasty and the skin has some obvious "feather". Rice is still good.
Chicken was quite nice and boneless, portion order was for 2 and it's delicious. Only problem is that the soup wasn't provided. Highly reccomend
Very disappointed n felt cheated by the restaurant. What show in the menu is different from what I buy home. No 🥦, no Thai sauce dou fu

Was ordering a set B for lunch 2 days ago on Monday. The set comes with steam chicken, rice, side dish mushroom and lotus root soup. Potion is just nice and tasty as usual. But what stands out from my dining experience was the service. I broke the strap of my mask accidentally while trying to put it on at the end of my meal and try to re-tie it. During payment, without my mentioning about my mask, the cashier handed a new and better one to replace mine. This make my day.

Good service from Ah Liang, keep it up.
This place never disappoints. Chicken is fresh, rice is fragrant.

Ordered the Set D chicken rice with pepper pig intestine soup.  Not impressive. Soup tasted like pepper water, ginger paste was watery.   Staff chatting non stop next to my table, couldn't have a relaxing lunch after a busy morning. Environment is very clean and cozy.Overall experience, 2/5.

Perfect place for a decent chicken rice. Ambience is great, service staff is polite. Price is at the high side, but still worth it. The vegetable is lightly salted and chicken rice is very fragrance. Their signature chicken is still the best as compared to the roast chicken. Chilli and ginger paste taste fresh and great too. Will come back again.

We had dinner there and the food was excellent. The service was quick. I have yet to go to a restaurant where all the food is served within 15mins. Only spoiler was it was a family night and a few screaming kids spoil it a bit for us.

Haven't had it for sometime now but the chicken rice, chicken, the fragrant soya sauce and chili plus the crispy tofu. Would like to add that the only missing item would be to have some nice hot soup served with the meal to make it even better

BTK has a name for itself, for good reasons. Fragrant rice and tender chicken, perfectly cooked and chilled which left it juicy and gelatinous. Fried tofu was also a surprisingly good dish - soft and silky inside, with a crispy and lightly salted skin. Avoid their coffee ribs, until they do something about it - we all had one bite and left the dish alone for good reason, it was both too sweet and too bitter, the coffee and sugar flavours did not merge successfully and left an awkward aftertaste.

Had dinner at the new compass one stall. The chicken is good. You must try the chicken when you are there. Ordered other dishes and found them too be good as well. I will surely return for more of the chicken rice.
The chicken dish used to be much better and rice is a little too starchy. The classic deep fried soft tofu still as good as ever. Still good overall.
Pathetic chicken rice set.. not sure how much meat in there but pure pathetic. Guess the better meat are reserved for dining in customer.
So yummy... Toufu is very crispy , must try it ... all food was delicious also ... love the all...
👍 😋 Chicken tasty 🐔 rice and fried bean curd with hard crust but soft 🔥 inside.
Nice fragrant chicken rice. Tender chicken pieces. The bundled meals are value for money. Chili adds a punch

Newly opened branch at Compassone about 2 weeks ago. Conveniently located a short walk from Sengkang MRT after walking straight down with Polar Puffs and Cakes on right, BTK is on the left. Restaurant has crowd waiting for takeaway and to dine in. Am glad it didn’t take too long for me to queue for takeaway. It only took 15mins for me and the customer before me to receive our takeaways. Maybe because it’s a little chaotic in the kitchen, some customers with queue numbers earlier than me were skipped.

The takeaways were very nicely packed with all sauces and sturdy cutlery set given. The Chicken rice tastes similar to BTK at Boon Keng. Takeaways are also available on Deliveroo.

Food is great, service used to also be good when they first opened, today was my visit after 6 months and I was disappointed.

Spoon provided was dirty, I asked for an exchange, the middle aged staff with dyed dark brown pony tail and hair bun attended to our table, no apologies provided. She took the list of order, which clearly stated 1 chicken rice, 1 plain rice, but served us 2 chicken rice instead. I highlighted, she did not even apologize and just exchanged with white rice.

We were preparing to leave and was about to wear our masks, halfway through she asked to clean the table. We kindly requested for her to wait till we stand up, she looked at her colleagues, repeated what we said while rolling her eyes. The reason we requested that was because we had past experiences where food and drinks were spilled onto our clothes during clearing, was it too much to ask since wearing mask was just 10-20 seconds?

Overall food was great, but fairly bad experience with this particular staff.
Never will complain about the chicken. The meat is tender. Generally good service and good food. Only need to take note of side dish price before you order. Some side dish could be over price!!

The food is generally decent but the staff attitude is hopeless.

I ordered a takeaway and was given a number buzzer. A staff came by and left my takeaway next to all the food orders on the table next to me. Not a single word that it was mine. The buzzer did not go off.

It was only 5 min later when I realised it was my order and asked the staff why noone told me it is mine.

This is the second time I have to deal with poor attitude from this branch.

Thanks to Covid-19. We’re only able to do takeaway. But since every restaurant is only able to do takeaway. They are competing among themselves with various deals & promos. Boon Tong Kee is no exception. They have some of the more value deals in the market. At $8 plus GST. You get boiled chicken, veggies, a meat ball & a side (fish slices, Thai tofu, prawn roll, meat ball, salad you tiao or pork belly mui cai). Not only this they got various other deals available. Check out the website. Thou their online service is really not up to standard yet. Some inconvenient as it’s not that 100% process.

Overall quite good.  Just chicken a bit tasteless (although v tender) if eat without the chilli sauce.
V crowded .
Delicious and good service . New outlet. Need to come early and queue up. 😊
Very nice and delicious chicken rice. Fully recommended to give a try.
Nice ambience, good service, and fragrant chicken rice. Only missing part is there is no soup served together
The combo set was a disappointment. There was any chicken meat at all for the chicken. Lots of skin and fats.

Excellent service provided by Alice from Compassone. She was extremely friendly and helpful. I saw her paying attention to the customers and took initiative to offer help. Very hardworking elderly lady. Other staff not as helpful, cashier was a little grumpy. Food is excellent as usual.

Super friendly staff who goes beyond to make us feel welcome despite us reaching at 9pm+ for a late dinner. Special mention to the very cute auntie who came over and gave us more cucumbers and making sure we have enough rice! Will come back more often! Food is excellent as usual :)

Superb service. I was initially confused when they didnt let me and my lil one sit at a vacant 2 seater, but realised they take seriously 1st come, first served and were planning to rearrange those seats for the group of 3 before us. They were also v kind to let me and my tired kid wait for seats inside at the sofa area and made my kid's day with a free lollipop. They cashier was very good in that she asked me first if it was ok, before offering the candy to my son. Very impressed by the service and kindness :) Thank you!

Outlet in Compass One with no chicken left after 730pm. Poor Business ethics and failure to provide enough number of chickens to serve customers. Wondering if customers buy chicken is like Singapore is undergoing another Circuit Breaker or end of the world. Else the outlet will only sell chicken rice at SGD$100 or One whole chicken at SGD$1000. I can't believe that the outlet does not even have chicken drumstick rice which I wanted to buy for my three year old for her dinner.
Do avoid Compass One outlet by all means if you do not want to leave Boon Tong Kee empty handed or you do not want to get deceived by price in Menu.

Totally will come back again. Very good service and the food is always so yummy! Staffs were very attentive and we're quick to top up drinks. They even bring extra continents when we din even ask for it. Love the fried beancurd! Must try!

Chicken is very smooth and tender, Fried beancurd was special and well-cooked. Ordered the Black pepper fish fillet, pretty nice sauce too! Egg was also very nice. Chilli and sauce all very good, but staff tends to be a little rough and noisy while clearing plates. Other than that it was a really good restaurant tho price might be a little on the high side, but very worth the quality

love their steamed chicken, highly recommend 1/2 chicken for 2-3pax, with their chicken rice of course. the rice is a must-try, it goes wonderfully with their smooth, tender steamed chicken. also suggest their 3 egg spinach (苋菜) and thai style tofu. worth the money, i'm a frequent diner here for sure.
Friendly staffs. Dishes are delightful. The chicken is one of the best I've had.

My toddler's chicken rice of choice - he loves it so much he proclaims chicken rice is now his favourite food of all time.

Also, the aunties and uncles working at the restaurant who pamper him always probably are factors influencing his proclamation. 😁
Just ok for me. Honestly I felt quite pricey ($90+)for just 3 persons.

Good chicken rice Service was good!
But chopping Chef and Trsinee....must clear once the plastic bin is half full og nones....looks aweful and unhygienic.....DO Not  wait till its so full that customers csn see....when we are looking at them chopping.....very unpro??

I love their hor fun. Full of wok hei. Requested for pork lard to fry together with the hor fun. So shiokadoo.
Staff very friendly and helpful. Clean outlet.
Clean n cozy resturant.  Staffs services are very good and polite.  Foods wise are nice too..
Food is really good... will go back again...
Good authentic chicken rice. I like the ambience and the crew too.
Staff were very friendly! Food was tasty too 😋😋 We had the steamed chicken and rice. Would recommend this place!
Went twice for their crab promotion, only $59 for an order of crab (2pcs), fresh and delicious! Fish is fresh too but their steam fish is a bit bland to me. Overall I enjoyed it, for my both visit.

It's a wonderful place when you have a family of young and old. Drop off elderly at LRT pick up point which is just outside restaurant. Sufficient big round tables for families. Park at hdb multistorey carpark beside seletar mall if you find mall parking too long queue or expensive.

Food is great here. Tasty, adequate servings, good service. They cook fast too.

Currently having promo 9.90 for  soon hock so good news for fish lovers.

The Heng hua thin bee hoon and lor mee suits different ages. Lychee meat will satisfy the young without fail, the special yam cubes for the older folks.

Give it a try esp if you're sick and tired of weekend crowd everywhere.

The food quality is good , fresh prawns used so that’s important for me. The mee sua (noodle) dish is a must have . Really yummy . If u order medium it’s good for 3 person , worth the money I must say . Love the century egg with wood ear .  Kudos to the chef there. Enjoyed my lunch !

Firstly the service there was super attentive. Not forgetting how delicious the food was! This restaurant is great for family gathering.  I enjoyed it so much with my mum and dad. ♡ will definitely be back again.

First time dining in for lunch (previously ordered via grab food) we enjoyed the food and was pleasantly surprised with the availability of dim sum. The staff were attentive and polite

Will definitely visit again, thank you!

They have a very big menu.
I particularly enjoyed the fried oyster cake, xinghua noodle and vermicelli. They also have good dim sum favourite like prawn dumpling and Xiao long Bao.

The dishes were okay for a family of 3 and the Thai style fish was surprisingly better than expected. The claypot eggplant is a must for those who likes. Aside from the limited seats and long service time, the rest are good. Recommended

Ordered via Grab Food.
The Heng Hwa Bee Hoon 兴化米粉 taste alright. The salted egg pumpkin is reasonable though I would preferred lesser flour version.

Nice. Taste is different from normal xin hua resturants.
Portions are quite big too.

There is -20% ala carte mon to fri till 5pm
My neighbourhood best food place to go to. Superb tasty, and highly recommended. Authentic foodntaste

Been here with my family weekly since they opened as I stay nearby and glad to say we are still as satisfied as the first time we are here! Food always good. We always order their beehoon and meesua and recently they added some items to their menu and their crabs promotion is very worth it and super tasty! I must say taste even better than some of the high rated seafood restaurant's crab. My mum loves their red wine chicken and my children loves their 辣子鸡! Will be back this weekend with my family! 👍🏻🙂

Best xinghua food I've tasted so far. I personally find it better than putien even and priced very well. Ordered delivery thrice in 2 weeks, taste wise standards are high and consistent with good wok-hei, portions were big and delivery wait wasn't too long. Highly recommend!!!

Unexpected gem! Each dish we ordered were yummy, and served super quickly too 👍🏻👍🏻👍🏻

辣子鸡 was super crispy and flavourful! Cabbage fried rice sounded very normal but wow it was definitely a good plate of fried rice - recommend to try it! Everything else, like the lor mee, Xing hua bee hoon, 奶白 were above average too~

only the fried yam and duck roll were slightly disappointing, because the amount of duck in there was pretty insignificant.

will definitely return!

The quality of the food is always constant. Even with the crowd, the servers tried their best to serve with a smile. With a Chinese restaurant setup, always have promos on-going, it is definitely worth it to dine with friends anf and family.

1st time ordering from this restaurant, most staffs are quite ok but I’m impressed by a young pretty girl named Tong..
She was extremely polite and helpful, never gave me the feeling of any impatient or frustration vibes when I actually asked her alot of question regard the costs, packaging of the food for take away etc.. I must admit that I took up quite a while of her times. Thank you Tong for your good services & recommendation of all dishes, my whole family really enjoyed all the dishes.
Good food at reasonable pricing..
will come back to dine in next time..

Wonderful Hokkien dishes that include the Xing Hua Bee Hoon, Cabbage Fried Rice and Toufu. Oh yes, the teas are refillable with hot water.
It’s a nice, comfy place right next to Fernvale LRT and I would come back again with my family.
Excellent  Service  and food is of high quality and portion for small is good size . Staff very helpful  n patience. Will come back again. Keep  up the excellent standard. 😎
great food selection and great ambience. The staff and service are all nice as well. Recommended if you would like to at with your lrents or family as it has wide range food selection.

The worst service ever!!
Came early at 5.15pm to order a packet of XingHua Meehoon.
After ordering, waited there for quite long and was told it will probably take 45mins to an hour mall, so they told me to leave HP No. and will call when it’s ready.
After 2 hours later no call at all. It was 7.30pm. How can a packet of noodles take more than 2 hrs to cook!!
Went back to check on my order then found the food was cold and chucked at a corner.
Asked why they didn’t call, the staff shouted: Crazy, who has time to call you!!
I answered: You asked for my number and I waited for your call patiently.
She replied: it’s none of my business, you go ask the cook lah! It made me so angry. My neighbors also had similar experience!
The noodles were miserable at $13.40. Only crazy pple will eat there again!!
Food is nice and unique ! Xinghua beehoon, the signature dish is super fine and tasty! The sweet and sour pork meat is really tender and the soup has a very sweet after taste. All marvellous!
Food is tasty and staff very friendly 👍🏻
great food, great ambience, staff were friendly as always!
Nice food but the wait between dishes is too long because they gave priority to takeaway like Grab, food panda, deliveroo ... etc.
Tofu is silky smooth and seafood is fresh. Portion is just nice. Comfortable environment for eating and fast service.
Been to this place for many meals. Their lunch time promo of 20% discount is so worth it. The Xing Hua Bee Hoon is our favourite for quick lunch. Service is good and prompt too. 👍🏻👍🏻👍🏻
The customer service here is great and the waiting time is not considered long for me. The food is also very appetising and delicious.

Underrated gem, my experience having a meal there not too long ago has been a pleasant one.

Food variety is good, and those i ordered were really tasty and had good portions. We had the seafood fried rice, spinach, lychee sweet and sour pork, and the xiao long bao, all of which i found were really good and i don't really have any criticism for any of them; all were freshly made to order and not overcooked. Special mention to the sweet and sour pork which was crispy on the outside and juicy pipping hot on the inside coated with the sweetness from the lychee and tomato-based sauce fused in one.

The service was also impeccable; the staffs there were so attentive and most of all polite. They were welcoming and quick to ensure we had a really pleasant dining experience by tending to our requests or query (on dishes) very promptly.

Really recommend for people, especially people around the neighbourhood to come by here and show them some support.

I myself will definitely consider to come by here more often for meals after having experience how good the food and service here is.
Taste and prices are good. Promo crab and sea bass are really good value.

content:
This is to share my personal experience with GrabFood Singapore on Friday 5 July 2019. The food I ordered from GrabFood is from “Hua Zai HK Style Roasted Delight Rice & Noodle (Sembawang Outlet). It is located at: Blk 463 Sembawang Drive, Sembawang Riverlodge, #01-01, Singapore 750463. This food store have several branches in Singapore.

I ordered a whole roasted duck as well as 1/2 kg (500 grams) of Char Siew via GrabFood at S$ 40.50 Nett (after using a S$20 Grab Coupon) for my family. When the food arrived and my mum open the packing, she found that the Char Siew is “extremely little” and suspected something is amiss. She then contacted me and I rushed home to attend to the matter.

I then took out my “Digital Weighing Machine” and found out to my horror that the Char Siew only weigh “360 grams”. I contacted Grab Hotline and was told to file an “online customer service support”, which I do so later.

As the food shop is nearby my house, I took the whole food package and paid them a visit. The shop staff don’t seemed to be bothered to my complain and directed me to call their person-in-charge (PIC). After several attempts, the PIC finally answered my phone call.

The food menu has indicated 1/2 Kg (i.e. 500 grams) for the Char Siew and why I am only given 360 grams? This is a shortage around 25%.

At the end, the food shop finally gave me a “300 grams of Char Siew” as a “make up” after a long wait around 30 minutes.

This case shouldn’t have happened. It is unknown and remain a question mark whether the food stall staff or the Grab delivery boy has short-changed or taken my “Char Siew” initially. A lot of time and effort have been wasted on this matter if the related party are sincere doing business ethically.
